citeinfo.title: Digital representation of the Montana state geologic map in ARC/INFO export format.
citeinfo.othercit: Files are both ARC/INFO export format (4 files) and PDF.

descript.abstract: This report describes the contents of a digital dataset which consistsof four ARC/INFO Export format files. The dataset includes a digitalrepresentation of the Montana state geologic map.
descript.purpose: To provide to the public a digital geologic map database of the Montana state geologic map.
descript.supplinf: It appears that the geology coverages wmtgeol and emtgeolwere fitted to a standard state boundary using the rubber-sheetmethod while the arc coverages wmtarcs and emtarcs either werenot or were fitted somewhat differently. Consequently thegeographic correspondence between arcs and geologic unitboundaries is more faithful away from the map's edges,and near the state boundary arcs appear to be displacedrelative to geologic unit contacts.

theme.themekt: National Geologic Map Database Catalog themes, augmented

idinfo.datacred: Digital products such as this map would not exist without the geologic mapping of generations of geologists whose work contributed to the small-scale state geologic maps that have been published by most states. We gratefully acknowledge the work of the geologists and agencies that supported compilation of this map. Those agencies include the US Geological Survey and the Washington State Department of Natural Resources. We particularly wish to acknowledge Patrick Geehan, the Bureau of Land Management Project coordinator for the Interior Columbia River Basin Ecosystem Management Project, for recognizing the importance of geology to ecosystem management and for supplying funds to digitize the Washington map.

dataqual.logic: The USGS provided basin-wide, integrated, digital inmornation about bedrock lithology, compositional classifications of lithology, potential animal habitat, stream sediment geochemistry, volcanic and earthquake hazards, and mineral resources.

procstep.procdesc: The map was processed digitally, as follows: the source material was scanned, the scanned image was vectorized and topologically structured, the lines and polygons were edited and proofed, attributes were added and proofed, the map was transformed from scanner units to geographic coordinate, and finally, map distortions were removed by rubber-sheeting. The initial objective was to obtain a digital representation that, when plotted, would overlay the source material within a line width; the digital version of the map meets this test.

attr.attrdef: Line type

edom.edomvd: Location of a linear feature other than a fault

Positional accuracy
Denotes that arc is both a fault and contact
LTYPE, MODIFIER, and ACCURACE combined and one attribute
Map unit symbol. This field provides a relational key to theassociated table wmtgeol.tbl or emtgeol.tbl (these two tablesare identical) which provides additional information abouteach formation.

enttyp.enttypd: Linear geologic features of western Montana (same attributes as arc coverage EMTGEOL.AAT)
Geology of western Montana at specific locations (same attributes as polygon coverage WMTGEOL.PAT)
This is a lookup table providing specific information about eachgeologic unit. The FORMATION field can be used to join thistable with the polygon attribute tables of the wmtgeol andemtgeol coverages.

attr.attrdef: The map unit symbol used on the published map. This is the itemthat is related to the map coverage. This is not necessary aformation in the normal usage. It is a map unit. (String of width 11)
The map unit name from the map explanation. (String of width 75)

attrdomv.udom: Formal and informal names with a minimum of abbreviation

attr.attrdef: The general rock category from the map explanation. Generallythis is something like sedimentary, igneous, or metamorphic.(String of width 50)

distinfo.distliab: This report is preliminary and has not been reviewed for conformity with US Geological Survey editorial standards or with the North American Stratigraphic Code. Any use of trade, product, or firm names is for desciptive purposes only and does not imply endorsement by the US Government.
